article.headline: Montana St. 84, Montana-Western 59
article.story: BOZEMAN, Mont. (AP) -- Forward Branden Johnson scored 16 points on seven-of-ten shooting to lead Montana State over Montana-Western 84-59 Wednesday night. Montana State (2-3) gained the lead in the first minute and never lost it. The game marked the first time in several years Montana State has played Montana-Western. Former Montana State coach Mick Durham would never schedule a game against Montana-Western, which is coached by his brother, Mark Durham. He wanted to keep peace in the family. But now that Mick Durham has retired from coaching the Bobcats, the game was scheduled. Forward Nick Dissly made only two of seven attempts in the first period, but his quick scores to start the second period sparked the Bobcat rally. Montana-Western (2-4) went almost seven minutes without a score in the second period, allowing the Bobcats to build up almost a 20 point lead. Montana-Western out-rebounded the Bobcats 43-39, but finished the game with a dismal 32.8 field goal percentage. MSU's leading scorer this year, Carlos Taylor, ended the game with only 9 points, although he put up five assists. Montana-Western guards Gus McDonald and Zach Pitts finished with 11 points apiece. Pitts led the Bulldog defense with six rebounds. McDonald picked up three rebounds and three steals.
